definition: one side/other/different/lateral component of a Chinese character (such as 刂[dao1], 亻[ren2] etc)

white/snowy/pure/bright/empty/blank/plain/clear/to make clear/in vain/gratuitous/free of charge/reactionary/anti-communist/funeral/to stare coldly/to write wrong character/to state/to explain/vernacular/spoken lines in opera

sentences.english: These wistful asides are only part of the story, for him and others.
sentences.chinese: 旁白，就他和别人而言，只是故事的一面。

sentences.english: A voice-over on the DVD describes the sex as 'exciting'.
sentences.chinese: DVD上的旁白描述性行为是一种“刺激”的行为。

sentences.english: The Stanley Parable is a first person exploration game.
sentences.chinese: 这是一个旁白叨逼叨向的游戏。

sentences.english: You can add existing sound files or record your own voice-over.
sentences.chinese: 你可以将现有的声音文件，或录制你自己的配音旁白。

sentences.english: Second, the historical prologue bridges the gap between generations.
sentences.chinese: 第二点，这段历史旁白缩小了不同是代际之间的差距。

sentences.english: The inner thoughts of the characters are continually exposed by means of asides.
sentences.chinese: 人物的内心思想不断用旁白揭示出来。

sentences.english: And let me just detail some of those.
Not only is he the star of the poster, he narrates the trailer.
sentences.chinese: 他不仅是海报的主角，还是预告片的旁白。

sentences.english: In addition to the narration, the first scene shows the aftermath of the events.
sentences.chinese: 除开场旁白外，第一场景就出现了事件的结果。

definition: opening titles (of movie)/leader (blank film at the beginning and end of a reel)
fragment (of speech etc)/extract (from book etc)/episode (of story etc)
end credits (of a movie etc)/ending (of a movie etc)
to stir up emotion/to arouse sympathy/moving
dialogue (in a movie or a play)
